facts.text: Respondent No. 1, as plaintiff, advanced Rs. 12,500 as construction loan to respondents Nos. 2 to 5 (defendants 1 to 4, owners of open plot Jalaram Nagar in Greater Bombay) on August 12, 1959, against execution of registered deed of charge complying with S.18 of Bombay Rents, Hotel and Lodging House Rates Control Act, 1947.
Defendants 1 to 4 represented they were constructing building per plans submitted to Bombay Municipality and agreed to let portion to plaintiff on monthly tenancy upon readiness for occupation.
Defendants 1 to 4 completed construction but let premises to third parties, contrary to deed of charge.
Appellants (defendants 5 to 7) purchased property from defendants 1 to 4 on October 24, 1960.

Plaintiff instituted Rent Act Suit No. 784/6206 of 1963 in Court of Small Causes, Bombay, against defendants 1 to 7 for declaration of charge, recovery of Rs. 12,500 with 4% interest, sale of property in default, personal decree, injunction, receiver.
Defendants 2 and 3 filed no written statement; defendants 4 and 5 denied receipt of loan, called deed sham, contested jurisdiction due to pecuniary value.

Appellants in original written statement denied privity of contract, admitted purchase on Oct 24, 1960, claimed vendors let to tenants, no knowledge of charge, plaintiff aware; in additional WS, objected to jurisdiction under S.19 Presidency Small Causes Court Act as declaration of charge on immovable property.
Court of Small Causes, Bombay decreed suit on March 23, 1968: loan advanced, deed valid and binding on all defendants including purchasers 5-7, suit cognizable under S.28 as arising from S.18(3).
Appeal No. 400/1968 under S.29 dismissed by Full Court of Small Causes on August 12, 1968.
Appellants filed Special Civil Application No. 2545/1968 under Art. 227 before Bombay High Court, rejected on December 2, 1968.

legal_issues.text: Whether Court of Small Causes has jurisdiction under S.28 of the Act to entertain suit absent landlord-tenant relationship between parties.
Whether claim for enforcement of charge and recovery of construction loan arises out of provisions of the Act (S.18(3)) so as to attract exclusive jurisdiction of Small Causes Court under S.28.

petitioner_arguments.text: For S.28 jurisdiction, proceeding must be between landlord and tenant; here only debtor-creditor relation exists.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: S.28 Bombay Rents Act; S.5(3),(11) definitions

petitioner_arguments.text: Claim based on contract (deed of charge dated Aug 12, 1959), not arising out of Act; declaration of charge on immovable property not grantable by Small Causes Court.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: S.19 Presidency Small Causes Court Act; cited Shivaling Gangadhar v. Navnitlal, Bishan v. Maharashtra W.G. Co., Bombay Grain Dealers v. Lakhmichand

respondent_arguments.text: S.28 not limited to landlord-tenant; S.18(2),(3) permit claims by any person advancing loan without requiring tenant status.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: S.18(2),(3), S.28 Act; S.18(1) prohibits other payments

respondent_arguments.text: Deed complies with S.18(3); claim for charge/recovery arises out of Act as transaction permitted only thereby; but for Act, no such claim.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: S.18(3), S.28 Act; cited Importers and Manufacturers Ltd. v. Pheroze

court_reasoning.text: S.28(1) jurisdiction not confined to landlord-tenant for all matters; extends to any claim/question arising out of Act, e.g., recovery under S.18(2),(3) by non-tenant.
court_reasoning.key_observation: One type (rent/possession) requires L-T, but claims under Act do not necessarily.

court_reasoning.text: Deed of charge dated Aug 12, 1959 complies with S.18(3) conditions (written, registered, interest 4%, repayable terms, charge on building/land, completion in 2 yrs); transaction permissible only under Act.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Reliefs (charge, recovery) are claims arising out of Act; legality/validity questions under S.18(3).

court_reasoning.text: Distinguished precedents: Shivaling/Bishan/Bombay Grain involved L-T suits; Importers confirms claims under Act need not be L-T.
court_reasoning.key_observation: S.28 covers claims out of Act regardless of parties' relation.

court_reasoning.text: Rights flow from Act-enabled contract; test: claim would not arise but for Act (citing Hawke, Thompson, Gibralter, Union of India v. STC).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Recourse to contract terms necessary, but arises out of Act.

court_reasoning.text: Findings of fact by lower courts (loan advanced, deed valid, binding on purchasers) not challenged.

holdings.text: No landlord-tenant relationship required for all S.28 jurisdiction; extends to claims/questions arising out of Act.
Suit for enforcement of S.18(3) construction loan charge/recovery arises out of Act; exclusive jurisdiction of Small Causes Court under S.28.

precedents_cited.relevance: City Civil Court jurisdiction; L-T misuse claim not under Act.

precedents_cited.case_name: Bishan v. Maharashtra W. G. Co.
precedents_cited.relevance: L-T injunction suit; disagreed on strict L-T requirement for S.28.
Terrace possession suit between L-T under S.28.

precedents_cited.case_name: Importers and Manufacturers Ltd. v. Pheroze Farmrose Taraporewale
precedents_cited.relevance: S.28 claims out of Act need not be between L-T; jurisdiction even for sub-tenant.

precedents_cited.case_name: Union of India v. S.T. C. Co.
precedents_cited.relevance: Claims arising out of contract if recourse to terms needed.
'Arising out of' bankruptcy: claim impeachable but for bankruptcy.

precedents_cited.case_name: Thompson Sons v. North Eastern Marine Engineering Company
precedents_cited.relevance: Compensation under agreement is 'under this Act'.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Rents, Hotel and Lodging House Rates Control Act, 1947 (Bombay Act LVII of 1947)
statutes_cited.relevance: Defines L/T; permits construction loans via registered agreement with charge; exclusive Small Causes jurisdiction for arising claims.

statutes_cited.name: Presidency Small Causes Courts Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Bars declaration of charge on immovable property; overruled as suit arises under Rent Act.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Registration Act, 1908
statutes_cited.relevance: Deed registered notwithstanding Act; required for S.18(3).

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed appeal by special leave against Bombay High Court order rejecting challenge to Small Causes Court jurisdiction; upheld decree for plaintiff on construction loan charge/recovery as claim arising under S.18(3)/S.28 of Rent Act.
outcome.relief_granted: Lower courts' decree as prayed upheld (declaration of charge, recovery Rs.12,500 + interest, sale/personal decree, injunction/receiver).

key_quotes.text: "It is not necessary that there should be a relationship of landlord and tenant in respect of all the matters covered by S.28(1) of the Act, so as to give jurisdiction to the Court of Small Causes."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects strict L-T requirement for S.28 jurisdiction.

key_quotes.text: "The claim made by the plaintiff in the suit could never have arisen and the transaction in question could not have taken place, but for the Act."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Defines 'arising out of Act' test for jurisdiction.

key_quotes.text: "Section 28 confers jurisdiction on the Court of Small Causes not only to entertain and try any suit or proceeding between a landlord and a tenant relating to the recovery of rent or possession of the premises but also to deal with any claim or question arising out of this Act or any of its provisions."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Quotes Importers precedent; clarifies broad S.28 scope.
